security_audit.summary: Prompt-only skill containing documentation and workflow instructions. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or command execution capabilities exist within the skill itself. The shell commands shown are documentation/examples only.

content.user_title: Merge GitHub Pull Requests with validation
content.value_statement: Merging Pull Requests without proper validation can lead to broken code in production. This skill enforces pre-merge checks, confirms with users, and handles branch cleanup automatically.
actual_capabilities: Checks all review comments have replies
Merges PR with formatted commit message
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) installed and authenticated
Cannot merge if branch protection rules are enabled
Cannot resolve review comments (requires pr-review skill)
Cannot force merge when approvals are missing

use_cases.title: Safe PR merging workflow
use_cases.description: Validate and merge Pull Requests with automated checks and user confirmation before execution

use_cases.title: Enforce merge quality gates
use_cases.description: Ensure all tests, lint, and CI checks pass before allowing any PR to be merged

use_cases.title: Streamline merge process
use_cases.description: Automate post-merge branch cleanup and maintain clean repository structure

prompt_templates.title: Simple PR merge
prompt_templates.prompt: Please merge this PR. Run the pre-merge checklist, confirm with me, then merge and clean up the branch.

prompt_templates.title: Merge with validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if all tests pass, lint is green, CI checks are complete, and all review comments have replies before merging PR #42.

prompt_templates.title: Fast-track merge
prompt_templates.prompt: Merge the feature branch into main. Run full validation first, show me the summary, and wait for my confirmation before proceeding.

prompt_templates.title: Batch merge
prompt_templates.prompt: Review and merge all completed PRs that have all checks passing, no unreplied comments, and are ready for merge.

best_practices: Always run full pre-merge checklist including tests, lint, and CI checks
Never skip user confirmation before executing merge
Always delete feature branch after successful merge to keep repository clean
anti_patterns: Merging without running tests or checking CI status
Skipping user confirmation to speed up workflow
Ignoring unresolved review comments before merge

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. All tools can use the skill when you ask to merge a PR.

faq.question: What happens if tests fail?
faq.answer: The merge process stops immediately. The skill informs you which tests failed and waits for you to fix them before retrying.

faq.question: Can I merge without deleting the branch?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill uses --delete-branch by default, but you can ask to keep the branch after merge if needed.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill that guides you through merge commands. It does not execute code or access your files directly.

faq.question: Why are unreplied comments blocking merge?
faq.answer: Unreplied comments indicate unresolved feedback. The skill directs you to use the pr-review skill to address them first.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub's squash merge?
faq.answer: This skill uses merge commits (--merge) to preserve history, unlike squash merge which combines all commits into one.
